review: We must have gone through changes with our cable carrier.  For about 6 months, we were able to view and download movies.  Then they changed our cable boxes and the buffering of the movies became a problem - the movie would stop and have to be reset at least 6-8 times per movies.Spent the weekend watching movies - no buffering problem - it was great!!
author: DeeK

review: As a long-time Roku user, I knew i was ready for an upgrade and almost placed that order a month ago but cash flow did not permit. Suddenly, Amazon Fire TV was released and I did my homework--read all the reviews, compared the options, learned the differences. Amazon Fire TV arrived and it was an easy set-up and transition from Roku. It is faster (as promised)--it cut down on the buffering problem I was having--and has a really cool voice-control option that I've used to find movies I've missed before. TV display is colorful, the remote is small, easy to use, and I am so happy I made the switch. You will be too!
author: bonlee

review: I only have cable service for my internet connectivity and my big HD CRT TV has been used solely for over-the-air news broadcasts for the past few years.  Now, the TV has once again become a Black Hole for time and productivity!  I have subscribed to Hulu+ and Netflix and can now watch all the shows I have been missing from cable.  Being a Amazon Prime member, there is a lot of content I can watch for free.  The box was simple to set up and so far am quite happy with it.
